intro: Gundlachia diffusa, commonly known as the spreading gundlachia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Gundlachia diffusa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to cascade from containers or grow in hanging baskets.
